data: Monitor patient for 15 minutes after dose
Injection area 15 minutes prior to buprenorphine injection

- Prescriber must have completed the buprenorphine long acting certification  - Patients must be already stabilized on buprenorphine long acting injectable (SUBLOCADE) OR on transmucosal buprenorphine-naloxone at a dose of at least 8 to 24 mg/day for a mi
Apply to the buprenorphine injection 15 minutes prior to injection
650 mg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab
400 mg, PO, pre-procedure, drug form: tab
1 application, topical, pre-procedure, drug form: cream

buprenorphine long acting should be administered subcutaneously over 15 to 60 seconds in the abdomen using the provided 19-gauge needle  Discontinue transmucosal buprenorphine-naloxone orders after buprenorphine long-acting injection given
300 mg, subcutaneous, once, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: syringe-inj, Use Patient Supply
100 mg, subcutaneous, once, order duration: 1 doses or times, drug form: syringe-inj, Use Patient Supply
650 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
dose range: 200 to 400 mg, PO, q6h, PRN pain, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, IV, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: inj
dose range: 25 to 50 mg, PO, once, PRN nausea or vomiting, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
2 mg, PO, QID, diarrhea, order duration: 24 hour, drug form: tab
Liver Panel (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
If history of pre-existing prolonged QTc or individual risk factors, order electrocardiogram
